pros: Career advancement opportunities if you want it
cons: None so far. Everyone has been amazing.

pros: Good support team, lots of challenges and learning opportunities, lots of training and flexibility with schedule
cons: Cons of being a practice manager, highs and lows but not related to avg directly

pros: This company bought the veterinary practice that I worked at. Previously I did not have health insurance through my company. This allowed me to have health insurance through my company. Even though the benefits were extraordinarily expensive and not affordable at all
cons: This company is the same money hungry corporation as all other corporations and veterinary medicine. There was a 6-month honeymoon in which everything seemed great. The benefits of the offered were extraordinary expensive and definitely not affordable on the salary paid. I paid a quarter of my salary every paycheck to get benefits that barely covered anything I needed to have done The management hired by the corporation was ill-equipped to handle the job. All the leadership that was done was belittling and could considered a type of bullying. Promotions were given to people with less or no experience . People that were promoted to leadership roles had no training on how to lead. People were hired because they would work for cheap, not because of their skills. Employees were treated like commodities, not like people. The workplace was not toxic prior to being purchased by the corporation but quickly became so. Certain people in the hospital became quick targets and Were made to feel unwanted and stupid. The hourly wage that was paid was extremely low, especially considering the experience of some of the people that work there. Amount of pay time off provided was ridiculously low. Numerous times that I know of, the behavior of the management was reported to the corporate office and nothing was ever done about it.

pros: There are none. You’d be better off working for a family owned/non-corporate vet clinic.
cons: Low pay, untrustworthy higher-ups, negative work environment, excessive price hikes, lack of incentive, non-trained management

job_title: Veterinary Practice Manager in Tampa, FL
pros: Growth opportunities (for the right people), good place to gain experience. Offers benefits (expensive) good amount of PTO. Offer CE.
cons: Overworked. underpaid. horrible favoritism in management. more about what the company can profit from then what can be done to help animals. They have a habit of hiring people without true experience and leaving them without guidance. High turn around rate for managers. Zero work/life balance.

pros: Benefits are better than private practice
cons: Corporate environment as you would expect

pros: Discounted treatment, medications for pets The animals

pros: There is so much support from leadership, I feel appreciated and knowledgeable every step of the way.
cons: There are no cons, I have never been happier to work in a company or hospital environment.

job_title: Veterinary Technician in Panama City, FL
pros: Medical benefits and paid time off.
cons: Will promise promotions, ability to learn new skills, etc. to get people hired but then not follow through which is why the turnover rate is so high.

pros: AVG is a fast-growing company with room to grow and expand
cons: A lot of hospitals to manage
